meanings.definition: To beat faster or more strongly than (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: Her heart outthrobs with excitement when she sees her favorite band.
meanings.sent2: The drum in the band outthrobs all the other instruments during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit's heart outthrobs as it races through the meadow, trying to escape the fox.
meanings.sent4: The thunder outthrobs the sound of rain as it rumbles across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The engine's roar outthrobs the noise of the traffic on the busy street.

meanings.definition: To surpass in intensity or frequency of throbbing.
meanings.sent1: The pain in his head outthrobs the ache in his stomach.
meanings.sent2: The headache outthrobs the discomfort in his back, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent3: The loud music outthrobs the sound of the wind outside, making it hard to hear.
meanings.sent4: The excitement of the crowd outthrobs the noise of the announcer at the game.
meanings.sent5: The pulsating beat of the music outthrobs the chatter of the people in the club.
